ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Kunark: first impressions
ygData.msgSnippet: i was in kunark doing those giants as well last night. I had my necro, was with a 51 paladin and a 42 shaman. we were holding the fort just the 3 of us, and
ygData.messageBody:
i was in kunark doing those giants as well last night. I had my necro, was
with a 51 paladin and a 42 shaman. we were holding the fort just the 3 of
us, and even pulling from the outside, we had a great time, i even got about
a quarter of a bub of xp (woo hehe)

it was a slaughter, made plenty of cash, pet got some nice junk armor and we
got some nice items too

some of those foreman tunics (blah)
a 10 ac belt all/all
lumberjack cap 10ac 3 stam
forest loop earing 2ac 3 dex/agi/wis (not lore so expect these to be wanted
by clerics/druids)
3 10ac/+7str rings (one each and they're lore)

plus some junk weapons. Was fun, was always about 60 to 80 mana so no danger
at all to hunt em.

I love the loot system in kunark, its random, so you dont see everyone
jumping the same kind of giant. most of the rings dropped on braes and crags

Rakka / Minkin
Sol Ro

*wonders if he can trade the ring for an SMR hehe*

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jeff Illian [SMTP:jeff@...]
> Sent: Friday, April 28, 2000 11:43 AM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Kunark: first impressions
>
> The giants also drop some funny weapons like a giant axe that is 45 dam,
> 150 delay, Orge, Bard, Troll
> warrior only or a sword dam 10 del 42 I believe. The Brae giants are
> green at 45 up to the Patriarchs
> and Steaps (sp?) which are blue at 51. The Brae are pretty easy and make
> up the bulk of the giants while
> the Patriarchs hit DARN hard and really takes a good party to take out (we
> had 2 warriors levels 51 and
> 46, a 51 shaman with the new slow spell which works AWESOME, a 45 druid,
> a 42 rogue and me and we still
> had both warriors under 2 bubbles of health when we got the AC25 tunic).
>
> Of course the REAL good stuff drops on the Pats, but the steaps and brae
> drop the weapons and tunics that
> you would want to sell to the vendors.
>
>
> "Daniel P. Sniderman" wrote:
>
> > I had a mountain Giant drop a Giant Forman's Tunic - AC13 -5 CHA +5 Save
> > Cold. SHM WAR SHK - BAR OGR TRL - sold to vendor for 64P!
> >
> > Question though - what player level range is reasonable for the Castle?
> >
> > Slyde Katzenjammer
> > 40th Level
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: "Jeff Illian" <jeff@...>
> > To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> > Sent: Friday, April 28, 2000 8:55 AM
> > Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Kunark: first impressions
> >
> > > Hehe, I had gone back to look at the stats last night so I have them
> with
> > me. You're in luck. But
> > > first, we mostly did Mountain Giants last night. We saw a number of
> new
> > items including a ring AC10 +10
> > > Strength, a tunic called tree weave AC25 +10 strength wearable by just
> > about EVERY class and race except
> > > pure nukers (mages/necros/wiz). My wife's warrior got the ring which
> goes
> > great with her Efreeti ring on
> > > her other hand. Another warrior got the tunic. The tunic looks like
> > leather so it is hilareous to see
> > > this warrior running around in all crafted and a leather BP.
> > >
> > > The necro stuff is a Flayed Skin Tunic, AC 16 -2 charisma, +5 to all
> > protect, +20 hp nec and shadow only
> > > and the bracer was AC6 -2 char, +5 int, +5 all prot shadow and necro
> only
> > I believe. The key though is
> > > they could not be worn by gnomes or inkies. I believe they are both
> > human/euradite only. Both items
> > > were looted almost back to back in Karnor.
> > >
> >
